title: What is the role of a K-pop group leader? - Quora

response.answer_text: As I’ve noticed through the short time that I’ve been a K-pop fan, a group leader usually: Speaks at interviews.Helps the group through tough times (the other members help too).At music shows backstage, the artists have to bow to seniors and juniors and exchange CDs with the other artists. This is usually the leader’s job.Motivates the group.Is mature and charismatic.Since groups usually live in the same dorm rooms, they need a group mediator to control all conflict.Makes decisions.Of course, some groups don’t have leaders because they don’t need them. A good example is Blackpink. Blackpink doesn’t have a leader because 1. They make decisions together and 2. At some point they all speak at interviews (Jisoo speaks at the Korean interviews, Rose and Jennie speak at the English ones, Lisa will probably speak at the Thai ones). <3

Usually it's the one who takes the lead Usually when giving a speech or talking to their CEO or something someone has to go there it would probably be the leader and they are also the ones that point some out that the group needs to be more this or like that or tell the members not to overdo themselves Usually leader have a big burden
